. Although the city is home to the world's biggest brewery for wheat beers, Europe's biggest spa, and
is only 10 min away, the city has kept most of its small town charm and historical center.

The official history of Erding starts in 742, although hints of first settlements go back as far as 2500 BC. The settlement was appointed a city in 1228 by Duke Louis I of Bavaria. During the Thirty Years' War Erding was burned to the ground by the Swedes thrice. The citizens were able to rebuild the city, though, with the help of the newly implemented tax on beer. During the last days of World War II, Erding was bombarded before surrendering to American troops without fighting back. After WWII the city kept growing continuously, and with the opening of
, which is located just north of the city, went into a boom, that is still continuing to date.
Erding is well connected by plane through

, which is located 10 km (6 mi) north of the city. The aiport is the second busiest in Germany and 7th in Europe, and offers a large number of flights to national, European, and intercontinental destinations.
leaves the airport every 40 min and takes approx. 20 min to get to the center of Erding. The car drive to the airport takes approx. 10 min.
, close to the city center, and
in the south of the city, not far from the spa. Both stations are part of Munich's public transport system MVV and Erding station is the northern terminus of the suburban train (
. The S2 serves the stations every 20 min and takes approx. 50 min to Munich Central Station.
Erding can be reached by bus from most surrounding cities and towns, like

Erding is very well connected to the rest of Germany by the autobahn network.

Coming from the north, east, and north-west use autobahn

and take exit 9 "Erding" and follow the aiport bypass street in southern direction until you reach Erding.

Arriving from Munich, the south, and south-east take autobahn
and leave the autobahn at exit 9b "Markt Schwaben" and follow the aiport bypass street in northern dircetion until you reach Erding.
Given the small size of the city, Erding is easily navigable on foot. The bike is also very popular among locals. Another viable option are the city buses.

value: content=A special point of interest for every beer afficionado is vistit to the world's biggest wheat beer (Bavarian:

. You can experience the brewing process with a little historical introdcution to brewing and the brewery, the actual tour through the brewing facilities, the bottling plant, and the huge warehouse. After the tour you can try as many pretzels, white sausages, and as much Erdinger beer you like (included in the tour price). The tours are often completely booked during German holiday weeks, so try to book beforehand.

content=The museum centers around the history of the city of Erding. It was founded in 1856, which makes it one of the oldest city museums. The museum is subdivided in a section for prehistoric times, Middle Ages, the time of the German Reich, and modern history after 1950.

(Beautiful Tower) marks the eastern end of the historic city center. It was built around 1408 in late Gothic style and is the last vivble part of the historic city wall. Like the rest of the town it was severly damaged in the Thirty Years' War, but rebuilt afterwards.
price=Galaxy 4h: €21, Sauna-Paradies 5h: €34, Special offers (late evenings, early morning) apply

content=To relax in Europe's largest sauna & spa area is almost a must for every visitor to the region. The 16 different water slides keep the kids occupied while the parents are relaxing in the (mandatory nude) sauna & spa area.
hours=(10 days after the last Friday in August) 11:00-0:00

content=The Erdinger Autumn Beer Fetsival is the third biggest beer festival in Upper Bavaria. It has 2 large beer halls and an amusement park. It takes place every year at the end of August / beginning of September.

In the city center you find a number of clothing and shoe stores and drug stores. Spread around the city are shops for daily needs, such as butchers, bakeries, grocers, and smaller supermarkets.

Within the "Business Park North-West" in the west of the city you find a DIY warehouse, shoe stores, stores selling consumer electronics, and more clothing stores and supermarkets.

value: content=The Dostojewskij is a cozy restaurant at the nothern end of Lange Zeile. The place is most popular for its opulent breakfast.

content=The plain interior of this restaurant in a historic building hasn't such a cozy feel as the "Erdinger Weißbräu" just around the corner, but is less overdrowded and loud. The restaurant focuses on raditional Bavarian dishes, with
(cheek of the ox in red wine sauce) as the speciality of the house.

content=Friends of the Indian cuisine will get their money's woth here. Unimpressive from the outside, the interior of the restuarant is that of a typical Indian restaurant in Europe. The service personnel is fast and attentive, and tries to meet all the guests' wishes.

content=This restaurant is one of the best regarding traditional Bavarian dishes in Erding. In a cosy and provate atmosphere, big portions of high quality food are served for a fair price. No credit cards accepted.

content=Typical Bavarian food in a rustic atmosphere. The menu is focused around local dishes, which are neatly arranged. Needless to say, that besides your standart juices and lemonades, the local Erdinger beer is served in this restaurant (the restaurant is in fact owned by the Erdinger brewing company). Reservations are recommended, as on weekend, evenings, and in summer the place fills up very quickly.

Erding's bar and pub scene mostly revolves around the city center at
. There are a few clubs and discos in Erding as well, though.

value: content=This huge club with 3 areas (techno, black, Schlager) is located on the top level of Media Markt electronics store in Business Park North-West.

content=This small airport and trade fair hotel with only 4 apparments is located in the center of town, close to restaurants and sights. Free parking is available. As the hotel has no maned reception, automated check-in is available 24/7. The rooms are spacious and modern and free wifi is available.
content=The McDonald's restaurant in Business Park North-West offers free wifi for its customers.

is only a short 50 min suburban train ride away. The city is Bavaria's cultural focal point with a vast number of museums, galleries, and other sights, and numerous shops and stores in every price range.
content=This quaint university town with its cathedral and the famous
brewery is just a 20 min car drive north of Erding.
